definitions.title: adv.
definitions.body: thus (NH abbrev. to [[כָּח]], with preps. [[בֵּין כָּח]] meanwhile, [[לְפִיכָח]] therefore; prob. either from [[כָה]] and [[כְּ]], lit. as thus, Ol:§ 223 h; or from [[כָּה כָה]] Kö:ii. 1, 253), somewhat more emph. than [[כּׂה]], usu. prefixed to word which it qualifies:—Ex 12:11 [[וככה תאכלו אתו]] and thus shall ye eat it, Ex 29:35, Nu 8:26, Nu 11:15 [[ואם ככה את עשׂה לי]], Nu 15:11, Nu 15:12, Nu 15:13, De 25:9, De 29:23 (cf. 1Ki 9:8, Je 22:8); so often with [[עשׂה]]: 1Sa 19:17 [[למה ככה רמיתני]] why hast thou thus deceived me ? 2Sa 17:21, 1Ki 1:6, 1Ki 1:48, Je 13:9, Je 19:11, Je 28:11, Je 51:64; once with an adj. 2Sa 13:4 [[מדוע אתה כָכָה דל]] why art thou thus lean ? Ec 11:5 answering to [[כַּאֲשֶׁר]]; Ps 144:15 [[העם שֶׁכָּכָה לוֹ]] the people to which it is thus. Once 2Ch 18:19 repeated, in this way…in that way (‖ 1Ki 22:20 [[בְּכׂה]]…[[בְּכׂה]]). Comp. the syn. [[כָּזאׁת]]. With a prep. once, in late Hebrew, Es 9:26 [[עַל־כָּ֫כָה]] concerning such a matter. With the interrog. [[אי]], [[אֵיכָכָה]] how ? (p. 32).
